title: Stagestruck 1
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Drama - Study and teaching
Music & Performing Arts/Drama - Study and teaching
Music & Performing Arts/Theatrical producers and directors
Music & Performing Arts/Theaters - Stage-setting and scenery
Music & Performing Arts/Amateur theater - Great Britain
Music & Performing Arts/Theater - Production and direction
description: A compilation of 4 separate episodes, this is the first of a comprehensive and informative series of three videos on everything you would like to know about theatre production, and in particular, amateur theatre. Amateur dramatics attracts people of all ages, from different backgrounds and for various personal reasons and this series, through the help of professional actors, directors, designers and stage managers, provides expert help and guidance to newcomers and even old-hands. Presented by Christina Barryk, aspects covered include: Set design, planning, painting, construction and set change; Makeup techniques for character roles; Stage manager's role; Drama director and Actors' workshop; Props and costumes; Sound equipment; Artistic director's role; Lighting; Touring companies. Also includes personal anecdotes interspersed throughout the program.
